caller_intent: Melissa Lail wants to change her insurance policy's deductible to $1,000 and inquire if her recent payment can be credited toward the new policy, affecting future payments.
resolution_steps: Agent Maria confirms the caller's intent to change the deductible and checks the payment history.
Maria explains that the payment made on the first of the month cannot be backdated but can be applied effective immediately.
Maria calculates the adjusted payment amount ($129.94) after applying the new deductible.
Melissa agrees to proceed with the change.
knowledge_required: Understanding of insurance policy changes and premium calculations
Ability to access and review customer payment history
Knowledge of how deductible changes affect premium amounts
systems_referenced: customer account system (implied through 'here we go into your account')
summary: Melissa Lail contacted Alliance Insurance to adjust her policy's deductible to $1,000 and clarify how her recent payment would apply. Maria explained that while the payment couldn't be backdated, applying the new deductible would reduce future payments to $129.94. Melissa approved the change, and the agent processed the adjustment.
